question.prompt: What is the principal (chief) question or concern you have regarding your current condition?
In your own words, please provide a brief narrative of the details of the problem for which you are requesting a second opinion. Please provide as much detail as possible in your description below:
If there was only one symptom we could help the patient with, which would you have us relieve? (choose one)
If other, please specify in detail below:
For how long has patient had this one above symptom? (choose one)

selection.text: More than 3 months but less than one year

question.prompt: If other, please specify in detail below:
Besides the one symptom above chosen as one to be relieved, Please choose all other symptoms below which patient is experiencing.
If other, please specify in detail below:
Does patient have a family history of any of the following conditions?
If other, please list below:
Does patient have a family history of cancer?
If yes, please provide additional information below:
Is patient currently employed?
If yes, what is patient's current occupation?
Has patient undergone a recent change in work environment?
Has patient undergone a recent change in home environment?
If yes, please explain in detail below:
Has patient ever used tobacco (cigarettes, cigars, pipe, chewing)?
If yes, is patient still using tobacco?
If no, when did patient quit?
If patient is still using tobacco, when did he/she start?
Please complete additional information below:

column_definition.label: # of times smoking pipe per day
Amount of chewing tobacco per day

question.prompt: Has patient consumed alcohol in the past?
If yes, is patient still consuming alcohol?
If no, when did patient quit?
If patient is still consuming alcohol when did he/she start?
How much alcohol does patient consume on average on a daily or weekly basis?
Has patient ever participated in illicit drug use?
If yes, when did this start?
Please describe in detail, the drug usage (include dates, what drugs used, ongoing or quit, etc.) below:
Does patient experience frequent sinus infections?
If yes, how frequent do sinus infections occur?
If other, please specify in detail below:
Does patient experience baseline continuous nasal and sinus symptoms?
If yes, how often do patient's baseline symptoms get worse?

selection.text: Never (the symptoms are always the same)

question.prompt: If other, please specify in detail below:
If symptoms are not continuous, does patient experience intermittent nasal and sinus symptoms?
If yes, how often do patient experience intermittent symptoms?
If other, please specify in detail below:
Do patient's symptoms improve between episodes?
Does patient experience nasal congestion and / or blockage (stuffiness)?
If yes, please describe this symptom in depth below (describe the symptom, when it developed, etc.):
Which side of patient's nose is most often affected?
Is this symptom (nasal congestion and / or blockage/stuffiness) present continuously?
Please rate the symptom severity

Is the congestion / blockage worsened by environmental irritants?

question.prompt:
The following is a list of health care problems/symptoms. Please mark 0-4 using the rating scale below indicate the severity of each separate problem. After you mark 0-4, you should mark the * if you are being treated by another doctor for that particular problem. Please make one choice (0 - *) for each symptom listed
Rating scale:
0 - this is not a problem
1 - this is a symptom but does not affect my quality of life
2 - this is a symptom and does affect my quality of life
3 - this is a symptom and worsens my quality of life
4 - I am not sure if this is a symptom
* - I am currently being treated by another doctor for this problem
What of the following type of treatment has patient received in the past for his/her condition (one patient is seeking a second opinion for)? (choose all that apply)

selection.text: Antihistamines such as Allegra, Claritin, Seldane, Zyrtec, others.
Topical nasal steroids such as Flonase, Nasacort, Nasonex, Rhinocort, others.
Systemic steroids such as Medrol, prednisone, others
Aspirin / Acetaminophen / over the counter non steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs such as motrim, ibuprofen, etc.
Topical nasal steroids such as Flonase, Nasacort, Nasonex, Rhinocort, others.
Other nasal sprays such as Astelin, Atrovent, over the counter sprays
Decongestants such as Allegra-D, Claritin-D, Entex PSE/La, Humibid/Duratuss (guaifensin), Sudafed (pseudoephedrine)
Other treatments such as saline sprays, nasal saline irrigations, herbal medicines, steam inhalation, humidifier, air purifier
